trans-unit.source: A trigger action is a simple SQL statement.

seg-source.mrk: A trigger action is a simple SQL statement.

target.mrk: A trigger action is a simple SQL statement.

trans-unit.source: use of SQL and Java in trigger actions

seg-source.mrk: use of SQL and Java in trigger actions

target.mrk: use of SQL and Java in trigger actions

trans-unit.source: CREATE TRIGGER . . . DELETE FROM FlightAvailability WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightAvailability WHERE YEAR(flight_date) < 2005);

seg-source.mrk: DELETE FROM FlightAvailability WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightAvailability WHERE YEAR(flight_date) < 2005);

target.mrk: DELETE FROM FlightAvailability WHERE flight_id IN (SELECT flight_id FROM FlightAvailability WHERE YEAR(flight_date) < 2005);

trans-unit.source: The trigger action includes not only the triggeredSQLStatement described in the "triggeredSQLStatement" section of the "CREATE TRIGGER statement" topic in the , but also the [ FOR EACH { ROW | STATEMENT } ] clause and the WHEN clause.

seg-source.mrk: The trigger action includes not only the triggeredSQLStatement described in the "triggeredSQLStatement" section of the "CREATE TRIGGER statement" topic in the , but also the [ FOR EACH { ROW | STATEMENT } ] clause and the WHEN clause.

target.mrk: The trigger action includes not only the triggeredSQLStatement described in the "triggeredSQLStatement" section of the "CREATE TRIGGER statement" topic in the , but also the [ FOR EACH { ROW | STATEMENT } ] clause and the WHEN clause.

trans-unit.source: A trigger action has limitations; for example, it cannot contain dynamic parameters or alter the table on which the trigger is defined. These limitations are detailed in the "triggeredSQLStatement" section of the "CREATE TRIGGER statement" topic in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: A trigger action has limitations; for example, it cannot contain dynamic parameters or alter the table on which the trigger is defined.
These limitations are detailed in the "triggeredSQLStatement" section of the "CREATE TRIGGER statement" topic in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

target.mrk: A trigger action has limitations; for example, it cannot contain dynamic parameters or alter the table on which the trigger is defined.
These limitations are detailed in the "triggeredSQLStatement" section of the "CREATE TRIGGER statement" topic in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.
